item.description: %% Zoottelkeeper: Beginning of the autogenerated index file list %% üóÇÔ∏è %% Zoottelkeeper: End of the autogenerated index file list %%
%% Zoottelkeeper: Beginning of the autogenerated index file list %% üóÇÔ∏è _Index_Big Data üóÇÔ∏è _Index_Databases %% Zoottelkeeper: End of the autogenerated index file list %%
Data Lakehouse #data #bigdata #data-warehouse A data lakehouse is a new, big-data storage architecture that combines the best features of both Data Warehouse and Data Lakes.
Data Lakes #data #bigdata A data lake is a centralized, highly flexible storage repository that stores large amounts of structured and unstructured data in its raw, original, and unformatted form.
Data Mart #data #bigdata #data-warehouse A data mart is a simple form of a Data Warehouse that is focused on a single subject or line of business, such as sales, finance, or marketing.
Data Warehouse #data #bigdata #data-warehouse A data warehouse is a unified data repository for storing large amounts of information from multiple sources within an organization.

ETL #data Stands for extract, transform and load, is a data integration process that combines data from multiple data sources into a single, consistent data store that is loaded into a Data Warehouse or other target system.
OLAP #data #bigdata #data-analytics Online analytical processing (OLAP) is software technology you can use to analyze business data from different points of view.
ACID #database ACID is an acronym that refers to the set of 4 key properties that define a transaction: Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, and Durability.

Databases #database #data Database is a type of Datastore with structured and semi structured data. It can be a traditional and highly efficient RDBMS which can use SQL or a modern semi structured NoSQL Databases to store data in different types.
NoSQL databases #databases #nosql NoSQL is a database which is neither relational and does not use SQL ro query the data for results.
